full_text: With a focus on protecting young people, the planet, and for social equality I launched @greenparty_ie’s alternative budget this morning with @neasa_neasa and @EamonRyan. You can read our full submission here: https://t.co/PfMT36HMHh https://t.co/YOLPBuWbIH

I spoke in the Dáil this evening to #SupportOurSecretaries - they're a vital part of our education system and have been the victim of an unfair two tier system long enough. @forsa_union_ie https://t.co/sdAZaI5mDt
Green Party wants every farmer to be paid to plant a hectare of trees each  https://t.co/E8XeUeAWJ4

Plant more #trees and save the #bees! This evening @EamonRyan and I will bring our native forests motion to the Dáil. We want a new deal for forestry in Ireland - one that supports continuous cover native broadleaf woodland, and protects biodiversity #ClosertoNature https://t.co/ClFO6b1kpi

The British proposal, as reported, runs contrary to the ongoing consolidation of precious peace achieved by the Good Friday Agreement which was supported by the people of Ireland, north and south. https://t.co/WLx1JbSRr8

Very proud of #Carrickmacross, where I grew up, in leading the way on a deposit return scheme. Hard to believe the Gov is still blocking the @greenparty_ie #wastereductionbill which would introduce these schemes nationwide & ban single use plastics #notoplastic @CarrickmacrossT https://t.co/prUG6nl4kN
@beibhinnbyrne @ColetteFinnCork @greenparty_ie @hazechu @paulinegalway @carolynmoore_ie See you at the next meetimg Beibhinn!

@dhubhda @ColetteFinnCork @greenparty_ie @hazechu @paulinegalway @carolynmoore_ie Get well soon Sandra !

Fantastic Mná Glasa gathering this evening chaired by @ColetteFinnCork discussing how we can support and encourage more @greenparty_ie women to stand for election and also how we can work together to influence Green Party policy #morewomen #ClimateAction https://t.co/063w9oJLPz

@ElsaidSaid @alisonoconn @Ciairin @Alisoncowzer @DeirdreMortell @women4election Glad you enjoyed it Sarah.Hope another take- home was also that you are one of those determined strong women who can make a difference and we need #morewomen like you !
Fascinating presentations at @forsa_union_ie #4dayweek campaign launch and also delighted to catch up with Fórsa President Ann McGee  this morning #Better4Everyone https://t.co/oq4knbwXI8

#History informs our understanding of how we are where we are today & gives us the ability to critically analyse the world around us. It needs to be a core subject & the power to secure history on the JC curriculum ultimately lies with the Minister. #maketherightcall https://t.co/SWL0fnp5zm

Fantastic leadership on #ClimateAction from the students of @BHCMonaghan with their #plasticfree #plexit campaign. Wonderful to be back in Beech Hill and catch up with my former teaching colleagues from many yrs ago - have lots of great memories of this terrific school ! https://t.co/39jGx85FFZ

'The Government can no longer ignore or delay action on climate change' #ClimateStrike #ClimateAction   Government urged to take climate action after thousands of young people protest https://t.co/EdvlcN3iCq
Beautiful day (suspiciously warm!?) for a #ClimateStrike with @greenparty_ie & @younggreens #ClimateChange #ClimateEmergency https://t.co/yYkUpePKlM
Managed to find my husband @FNDuffy amongst the thousands and thousands at the #ClimateStrike in #Dublin united in our call for real #ClimateAction #climategeneration https://t.co/iBVzeVoxBb
@nialljpmurphy @BallinteerETNS Inspirational !!

Look at these amazing kids from @BallinteerETNS raising their voices to call for #ClimateActionNow - today is going to be a big day for #GenerationClimate #ClimateStrike #Dundrum https://t.co/2Rvn0E89fh

Fab to catch up with my friends and former colleagues in @sttiernanscs who are at the #Dundrum Climate Vigil protest with their students ahead of today's #ClimateStrike . Huge crowds already gathering in Dundrum.#FridaysForFuture #climategeneration https://t.co/z5WKJxfPYf
@SusanAdamsEco @greenparty_ie Thanks Susan..see you there!
See you there @StepAgainstCC @StepasideETSS . Posters look fab. Will be joining you and thousands of others tomorrow to demand #ClimateAction #ClimateStrike #ClimateEmergency https://t.co/xQYJUW4kbP

And the Minister indicates that although they will support our @greenparty_ie #JustTransition Bill tonight that the money message will be used at a later stage to block it. Yet again Gov uses the money message to stop #climateaction. #notgoodenough https://t.co/SUIsHTc2Wg

Tomorrow, schoolkids around the country (and the world!) will be going on #ClimateStrike. I hope you'll join me in supporting them! Climate striking isn't infuriating; climate inaction is. Let's make some noise! #ClimateActionNow https://t.co/Yl4ftjgRbX
@oboyleconal @cian_mccormack Maith thú Conal !
@MrsDebbieHJ @OireachtasNews Keep in touch - lovely chatting to you!

I was chatting to the @GreensUcd this evening about my experiences with the Oireachtas Women’s Caucus and how we make politics more accessible for women - hope to see some of them in the Dáil in the future! #MoreWomen https://t.co/B87Z4C3w5E
Míle buíochas and well done to the wonderful @sineadmercier for all her work on drafting our #JustTransition Bill https://t.co/FvgOKOqFL5
Please spread the message about this welcome initiative from @gaabsj, and encourage anyone you might know who would be interested to sign up for the new team! @dmcambrois https://t.co/2OFU8d7X9T

Our response to #ClimateChange has to be socially just. @EamonRyan and I will be bringing our #JustTransition Bill to the Dáil tomorrow evening to set up a commission to work with Fossil Fuel workers and plan for a green future that everyone can share in. https://t.co/2erC4PatNm

Delighted to host ‘Women Champions of Peacebuilding" -a celebration of women across our island working together to make a difference.Many thanks to @irishrurallink for organising this event #morewomen @PoliticsPlusNI @DooleySinead @NICVA @Kelmba https://t.co/smapT5c7n5
@Money_Care Thank you

This appalling construction happened under the State’s watch but Gov. refuses to consider possible ways of helping homeowners. Our ⁦@greenparty_ie⁩ motion on #buildingstandards passed over 2 yrs ago in the Dáil and outlined ways of assisting them.  https://t.co/8poal8JlNE

Today is #WorldSuicidePreventionDay. While we can all do more to support people experiencing mental health problems, we also need to hold the government to account for failing to provide adequate mental health services, particularly for young people #WSPD2019 #WSPD

World 'gravely' unprepared for effects of climate crisis. Study says greatest obstacle isn't money but a lack of “political leadership. Let's take to the streets to #climatestrike on Sept 20th to demand that leadership #climateemergency #FridaysForFurture https://t.co/n30Za5jggc

Government cannot continue to ignore apt owners facing nightmarish bills to make their homes safe.This shoddy construction took place under the State's watch & homeowners need assistance.Well done to @NiamhTowey1 for consistently highlighting this issue! https://t.co/lkZIhvYgxh https://t.co/zrk5lRttdQ

“Delighted to launch the @InclusionIre report “Education, Behaviour and Exclusion" Heartbreaking to hear the stories of children who have been excluded from schools on the basis of their disabilities - we need the Minister to issue a directive to end this practice. #Equality https://t.co/gT99OSYcpm

Excellent news - well done! #StreetsAreForPeople https://t.co/PMoDAyMMy9

Looking forward to calling into @TCD_Greens this week ! https://t.co/1MesvFJoqq
@muinteoirodwyer Best of luck in your new school Paul -Beir bua!

@RathdownGreens @greenparty_ie making seed bombs at our Sunday morning get together in Clonmore Park. Thanks to Eleanor and Robert from Plant Bandits for lending a helping hand!  #biodiversity #stillorgan #dublinrathdown https://t.co/XkwyUPEqhL

So sorry to hear that the courageous and inspirational Fr Tony Coote has passed away. Ar dheis dé go raibh a anam dílis.  Social justice campaigner Fr Tony Coote has died aged 55 (via @IrishTimes) https://t.co/hs15l088Gc

This is absolutely appalling. We must stand firm against any and all racism.   Violence like this stems from racist rhetoric. Words become actions.  We must condemn racism at all levels if we want to stop violence & discrimination taking hold.  https://t.co/2UJFfoyvi2
@docinthehaus Hi Patrick - I wouldn't have this information to hand right now, but I've put in a question on it to the Minister. Unfortunately I won't get an answer until late September

Given the need to do further remedial work for 17 of these schools during holidays over the next two years, what assurances can the Department give now that these school are in fact safe to reopen in September?  https://t.co/tQ8vW8SB9e

There you have it - Fine Gael openly showing their contempt for equality of opportunity in higher education.  This attitude is appalling and  reminds us how Gov is completely out of touch with the reality of student life and barriers to education https://t.co/QZvlVmVInY

Appalling to hear at Ed Committee that a student has been on a reduced timetable for nearly 2 yrs! Dept of Ed has no data on how the reduced timetabling is operating - choosing to ignore children who are bring deprived their right to ed & schools remain in dire need of resources https://t.co/nYT4fN3zwi

My next constituency advice clinic is in the Glenside Pub in #Churchtown, this Friday, June 14th from 10.30am - 12pm. Our @greenparty_ie Councillor for the #Dundrum ward @danieldunne will be there too so please call in for a coffee to discuss the issues that matter to you. https://t.co/Jyy5RMBacJ
